text: Ramón Hoyos Vallejo (26 May 1932- 19 November 2014) was a Colombian road bicycle racer. He won the men's individual road race at the 1959 Pan American Games. He represented his native country twice at the Summer Olympics; in 1956 and 1960. Hoyos died of a heart attack in Bogota, Colombia, aged 82. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2014 deaths Category:1956 Summer Olympics Category:Competitors at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Colombian cyclists Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction
title: Ramón Hoyos
